segments.text: Ugh, look at that filthy water pouring from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's soaking everything—the cabinets, the floor, her shoes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's just drying a plate, oblivious to the gross mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That puddle is disgusting; it'll attract all kinds of dirt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now the kids are making it worse, climbing around in there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy’s hand is rummaging in the cookie jar like a thief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the stool is unstable—imagine the sticky cookies falling into the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s waiting with her hand out, probably for crumbs.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole kitchen is turning into a slimy disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Even the calm garden view can't make this look clean.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand watching such a nasty scene unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR
